CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 23, 1958, pg. 3, reads: "Right There! - Althera Hawkins (dark glasses) points to the area on Centre Ave., near Roberts St., where he parked his car and became involved in an exchange of vulgar epithets and a near-fight with Patrolman Herbert James.  Hawkins was arrested, charged with disorderly conduct, assault and battery and inciting to riot.  Without either participant showing scars and marks incident to an assault or battle, Magistrate John J. Fiorucci fined Hawkins $25, which he paid.  No evidence was produced to prove that a riot was incited. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Althera Hawkins pointing to street in front of parked car, Centre Avenue, Hill District
